name: Armenia
description: Winter is closing in. The days are rapidly shortening and inland city temperatures drop from the high teens to single digits. Snow begins to fall in the mountains.

name: Austria
description: Many museums outside the capital have gone into winter hibernation, the days are getting short and the weather can be poor. Cafes, pubs and restaurants become the focal point.

name: Azerbaijan
description: Winter is closing in. The days are rapidly shortening and inland city temperatures drop from the high teens to single digits. Snow begins to fall in the mountains.

name: Belgium
description: Christmas markets begin making the rounds of many a town square. These typically come with nativity scenes that sometimes have living characters rather than mannequins.

name: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Croatia
description: The continent chills but the seaside can still be sunny, albeit not warm. Many hotels along the coast shut their doors for the season, as do many restaurants.

name: Cyprus
description: Expect a mix of weather, including clear summer days. It's a quiet month for annual festivities and many hotels and restaurants pull down their shutters for the winter break.

name: Denmark
description: Winter is coming, daylight hours are shorter, but to offset the gloom, Christmas festivities are under way by the end of the month.

name: Estonia
description: Autumn turns to winter as rainy days blend into snowy ones. This is one of the quietest months of the year - summer is long gone, yet winter holiday festivities have yet to begin.

name: Finland
description: Once the clocks change in late October, there's no denying the winter. November's bad for winter sports, as there's little light and not enough snow. It can be a good month to see the aurora borealis, though.

name: France
description: It's nippy now. Toussaint (All Saints' Day) on 1 November ushers in the switch to shorter winter opening hours for many sights. Many restaurants close two nights a week, making dining out on Monday a challenge in some towns.

name: Georgia
description: Winter is closing in. The days are rapidly shortening and inland city temperatures drop from the high teens to single digits. Snow begins to fall in the mountains.

name: Germany
description: This can be a dreary month mainly spent indoors. However, queues at tourist sights are short and theatre, concert, opera and other cultural events are plentiful. Bring warm clothes and rain gear.

name: Greece
description: Autumn sees temperatures drop. Olive-picking is in full swing in places such as Crete and feta production picks up, giving you the opportunity to taste some seriously fresh cheese.

name: Hungary
description: The month kicks off immediately with a public holiday: All Saints' Day on 1 November. After that the winter season begins, with many museums and other tourist attractions around the country sharply curtailing their hours or closing altogether.

name: Iceland
description: Summer is a distant memory. November sees nights lengthening (the sun sets around 4pm) and weather cooling, but Reykjavik parties hard, with big crowds gathering for its flagship music festival.

name: Italy
description: Winter creeps down the peninsula in November, but there's still plenty going on. This is truffle season. It's also the time for the chestnut harvest and mushroom picking.

name: Latvia
description: Autumn turns to winter as rainy days blend into snowy ones. This is one of the quietest months of the year - summer is long gone, yet winter holiday festivities have yet to begin.

name: Lithuania
description: Autumn turns to winter as rainy days blend into snowy ones. This is one of the quietest months of the year - summer is long gone, yet winter holiday festivities have yet to begin.

name: Netherlands
description: Cultural events and reduced low-season rates make up for the shorter days and chillier nights, while the arrival of Sinterklaas heralds the start of the festive season.

name: Norway
description: A quiet month for tourism in Norway with the winter chill starting to bite and the daylight hours getting shorter but many winter activities are still vet to begin.

name: Poland
description: The first significant snowfalls begin in the mountains, though the ski season doesn't begin in earnest until December. Elsewhere around the country, brisk temps and darkening afternoons herald the coming of winter.

name: Romania
description: The nation goes into hunker-down mode until Christmas and the cultural calendar grinds to a halt. Days are short and nights are cold.

name: Slovenia
description: The solemn holiday of All Saints Day (1 November) sets the tone for the rest of this grey, chilly month. On this day, Slovenes bring candles and red lanterns to the cemetery to remember the departed.

name: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Spain
description: A quiet time on the festival calendar, November is cool throughout the country. Depending on the year, the ski season usually begins in the Pyrenees and Sierra Nevada.

name: Sweden
description: Grey winter is here, but the holiday season has yet to begin. A good time for movies, markets and museums!

name: Turkey
description: Even on the coastlines, summer is a distant memory. Rain falls on Istanbul and the Black Sea, southern resort towns are deserted and eastern Anatolia is ensnarled in snow.

name: Ukraine
description: Autumn is over quickly leaving November cold and often damp. This is the best month to come to Ukraine if you like your destinations tourist-free.

name: United Kingdom
description: Winter's here, and November is a dull month. The weather is often cold and damp, summer is a distant memory and Christmas is still too far away.
